title: Understanding Next.js
content: Next.js is a powerful React framework that enables server-side rendering and static site generation. It enhances the development experience with features like API routes, built-in CSS support, and more.
author: Jane Doe

title: Getting Started with TypeScript
content: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds static typing to the language. It helps catch errors early in the development process and improves the overall quality of the code.
author: John Smith

title: Styling with Tailwind CSS
content: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that allows you to style your applications quickly and efficiently. It promotes a different approach to styling by using classes directly in your markup.
author: Emily Johnson

title: Building REST APIs with Node.js
content: Node.js is an excellent choice for building REST APIs due to its non-blocking architecture. This article covers the basics of creating a RESTful API with Express.js.
author: Michael Brown

title: Deploying Next.js Applications
content: Deploying your Next.js application is easy with platforms like Vercel and Netlify. This guide will walk you through the deployment process step by step.
author: Sarah Wilson
